Name: Bird-headed amulet
Description: The upper part of this greywacke amulet is decorated with two highly stylized bird's heads facing outwards. The rectangular body is notched at the bottom and has a suspension loop (?). Similar amulets are frequently found in Predynastic burials, often in pairs. They were possibly worn as pendants or tied to the body with leather strings. The precise meaning of these objects is unknown.
